fullProgramDescription: The Spanish major is designed to give students proficiency in the Spanish language and to introduce them to the cultures of the Spanish-speaking world. Students will be able to understand, speak, read, and write Spanish with increasing sophistication and will be acquainted with a wide range of literary and cultural texts, films, and other media.
shortProgramDescription: The Spanish major at UCLA provides students with a deep understanding of the Spanish language and Hispanic cultures, preparing them for various careers or further study.
classHighlights: Language courses: Students take a sequence of courses that develop their language skills, from lower-division courses that focus on grammar and vocabulary to upper-division courses that emphasize reading, writing, and conversation.

Literature and Culture courses: The major includes a range of courses that explore Hispanic literature and culture, from medieval to modern times, and cover various genres, such as poetry, narrative, and drama.

Advanced Language and Culture courses: Students take advanced courses that build on their language skills and cultural knowledge, exploring topics such as linguistics, cultural theory, and cultural production.
Electives: Students can choose from a variety of electives that allow them to explore specific interests, such as Latin American literature, Spanish film, or Hispanic cultural studies.
learningOutcomes: Communicate effectively in Spanish in writing and speaking
Analyze and interpret Hispanic literary and cultural texts
Understand the cultural and historical contexts of the Spanish-speaking world
Demonstrate an awareness of the diversity of Hispanic cultures and experiences
Apply critical thinking and analytical skills to cultural and literary texts
additionalInformation: Students are encouraged to study abroad in a Spanish-speaking country and to participate in internships or volunteer work that involves Spanish language and culture.
